Великолепно! Хоть, по-сути игра на один раз, но зато, какой! Все здесь настолько идеально, что хочется порой пройти ее заново.
Отличные и интересные головоломки, все красиво и интересно! Но самый главный шедевр Portal 2-разумный суперкомпьютер GLaDOS, наделенный капризным нравом, ядовитым сарказмом и страстью к опасным научным экспериментам. Божественная озвучка, особенно это касается англ. версии.
[spoiler]Героиня Portal, девушка по имени Челл, давным-давно разрушила коварную систему и выбралась из подземного комплекса Aperture Labs, но ее мигом затащили обратно. Очнувшись от искусственного сна по прошествии многих лет, она опять рвется на волю. Благо, у нее на сей раз есть помощник — болтливый, слегка истеричный бот Уитли. Вынужденный «отдых» лишь прибавил GLaDOS желчи — едва воскреснув, обиженная система начинает отгружать вагонами едкие шутки и издевательские тирады. «Помнишь, я говорила про бесполезный вонючий мусор? То была метафора. Я имела в виду тебя. Прошу прощения. Ты тогда не отреагировала на мой комментарий, и я испугалась, что он прошел мимо твоих ушей. И что мое извинение выглядит глупым. Поэтому мне пришлось еще разок обозвать тебя мусором».[/spoiler]
Увидеть Portal 2 от заставки до замечательного финала должен всякий, кто любит ироничные тексты и чья голова не набита опилками. Эта игра явно успех для Валв, да еще и какой!  
10\10

One of the best Valve games to date. Its single-player provides ample amounts of genuinely funny and compelling narrative and some great puzzles, while the co-op takes the game's mechanics and pushes them to their absolute, playable limit.The single player has one of the best voice acting i have ever seen in a video game. Portal 2 may be the best game of 2011.

One of my favorite games, deep story, challenging puzzles and flat out fun. 9/10.

The natural sequel to the [i]Portal[/i] game. The game play is similar to [i]Portal[/i], but with a couple additions. Aside from the brain-scratching puzzles to solve, the most interesting part of [i]Portal 2[/i] is the background of Aperture Laboratory and the rivalry between GLaDOS and Wheatley. There are also a lot of great community maps available at the workshop.

Certainly not a game to miss here.

Portal 2 is the type of game you play when you need a little challenge, and need to figure something out. You can't expect to sit down and just play a game for the fun of it. Sometimes you don't know the answer, and need to really think. That is why I like playing Portal 2. It has some parts where it jokes around and is fun. Also giving you something to think on and try ideas that come to you only after everything fails. This is what makes it so great, and why I play it.

I never used to play many games, just the occasional one like the Sims or Roller Coaster Tycoon but someone recommended Portal. So I played the first Portal and really enjoyed it so naturally I went ahead and tried the second one. This game is what made me a gamer. Now I'm trying out all the classics from BioShock, Half Life and Fallout, and am a regular on Dota 2. I love this game, the story is great and the humor gets me every time. If my phone could talk to me like GLaDOS, I'd nerd out every time. Great game, everyone should play through it at least once even if you don't like this particular genre.

This game is like WOW WOW WOW WOW! You play as Cher, the singer, but you have been abducted by scientists who want to test you for SCIENCE! They give you a gun that shoots portals and you can use them to move around and solve puzzles! And you are augmented so you can fall many distance without breaking your legs! It's super sugoi, onii-chan! And then in the co-op, you play as a robot and your friend is also a robot! You can play with your best friend or someone you don't really like and make their lives difficult and it is very fun either way. It is like a shooter but with puzzles. If you like video games (and i know you do!!) i HIGHLY recommend this game for you to enjoy!

A história do jogo de Portal 2 é realmente a sequência de Portal 1, o multi-player dele é fora da história, sendo uma história totalmente a parte, no multi-player eu não tive muitos problemas com lag. A única coisa realmente ruim no multi-player é a demora de quando você finaliza a fase, pois para ir para a próxima ele tem uma pequena cena que dura um tempo e que depois da quarta ou quinta fase, começa a enxer a paciência.

De resto é um jogo interessante e de fácil jogabilidade.

To anyone who claims that sequels are never a good idea because they're never as good as the original, I would usually agree. Except, of course, in the case of Portal 2. Rarely has so much been accomplished with a premise so simple. In an industry dominated by bloated AAA studios and greedy, almost insidious publishing houses, I hold up Portal 2 as a shining example of success through minimalism.

Great visuals, spectacular puzzles, clever and hilarious humor, phenominal cast and story. Oh, and the integrated workshop and puzzle creator basically ensure an infinite amount of levels to play. Easily one of the greatest games ever created.

It also host a new, fun co-operative Mode, which in itself is highly entertaining. The only downsides to this game is that their is no real competitive play, but otherwise An Amazig game. If you are wondering whether to play it or not, I Highly reccomend grabbing a copy.

Because I'm a Potato.....

Valve's Portal 2 is the award-winning sequel to the hit game, Portal. I do recommend that you play the first one in order to fully understand the whole story and for you to be familiar with the concept of Portals ^_^

You play as Chell, a mute girl that just does what she does :/ I seriously don't know what's going on in her head xD anyways, you wake up in a room years and years after the events of Portal and the adventure starts there.... Let the testing begin >:) 

Story is well-driven and easy to follow. Although the game features more/less 5 characters (including Cave Johnson and Caroline). They're so lively and have their own iconic personalities, Wheatley is awesome :D You'll never get bored of the dark humor continuously thrown at you xD I have to say that the story is a bit short compared to their flagship game, Half-Life.

The Source engine is by far my favorite. I'm playing this game at a consistent 100fps set to High/Very High.... no crashes in-game, and absolutely looks delightful (especially the lighting). It can also run very well on older systems, which is always a plus for me ^_^ Music is what you'd expect from Valve....... just pure awesomeness, nuff said xD 

Gameplay is the same as the first game. It's not a generic shoot-everything-that-moves FPS but a puzzle-solving FPS that involves Portals and require you to have a keen observation on your surroundings and lots of thinking. I honestly was stuck on a puzzle for a good 20-mins. until I went "Ohhhhh, now I get it" and proceed to finish the test chamber xD It stands out because of its one-of-a-kind gameplay and does it extremely well ;)

Overall Experience: I have yet to try out the co-op mode, but the single-player campaign left me wanting more. That feeling you get after solving a test chamber is quite awesome ^_^ and doing it again, but faster, feels even more rewarding. Although I have problems launching the game (It just might be my Steam client) the game itself runs incredibly smooth. I give this game two-thumbs up ;)
